verses.kjv: Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
verses.ct: Sing out loud to God, our strength! Shout with joy to the God of Jacob!

verses.kjv: Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
verses.ct: Start the music and bring out the tambourine, the beautiful harp along with the lyre.

verses.kjv: Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet at the new moon, at the appointed time, on our festival day.

verses.kjv: For this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
verses.ct: This is a decree for Israel, a law from the God of Jacob.

verses.kjv: This he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
verses.ct: He established this as a rule for Joseph's descendants as a reminder, when he went out against the land of Egypt — where I heard a language I did not understand.

verses.kjv: I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
verses.ct: "I lifted the heavy load from his shoulder; his hands were freed from hauling baskets.

verses.kjv: Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
verses.ct: You cried out in distress, and I rescued you; I answered you from the hidden place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

verses.kjv: Hear, O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
verses.ct: Listen, my people, and I will warn you: Israel, if only you would listen to me!

verses.kjv: There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
verses.ct: You must not have any foreign god among you; you must never bow down to an alien god.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
verses.ct: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.

verses.kjv: But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
verses.ct: But my people refused to listen to my voice; Israel wanted nothing to do with me.

verses.kjv: So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
verses.ct: So I let them follow their own stubborn desires; they lived according to their own plans.

verses.kjv: Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
verses.ct: If only my people had listened to me, if Israel had walked in my ways!

verses.kjv: I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
verses.ct: I would have quickly defeated their enemies and turned my power against their opponents.

verses.kjv: The haters of the LORD should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.
verses.ct: Those who hate the LORD would have come groveling before him, and Israel's prosperity would have lasted forever.

verses.kjv: He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
verses.ct: I would have fed them with the finest wheat, and I would have satisfied you with honey from the rock."
